website_summaries.verdict: The pro’s choice. It has everything you could want from an impact drill.
pros: It offers 3 speeds and DEWALT’s Precision Drive for maximum versatility
The 4-amp hour batteries give excellent run times, and you get two, plus the charger and a nice case
cons: A few users report chuck defects

customer_reviews.title: Strong Impact
customer_reviews.text: This thing is insanely powerful with an incredible battery life. I've pulled lug nuts off my truck with it, I've drilled hundreds of very long screws. It's my first Dewalt 20V purchase and I'm incredibly happy I've gotten into the product line.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Power
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this driver partly because of the brushless motor design, as well as the 4.0 Ah batteries . The three settings provide great versatility and good torque. And loved the color combination. But... I noticed that the battery doesn't fit tight and there is a bit of wobble when shook. The directional switch is a bit loose. And plastic quality hhmmm... Other than that it looks good and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you check that the batteries are good after buying so you don't run into my issue
customer_reviews.text: One battery was dead when I finally got around to using it which was a little over a month after buying. I bought it for a project but had to delay starting it due to having to unforseen circumstances. Guess I should have checked both batteries after purchasing but I didn't think I would have to after buying a Dewalt. Make sure you check that the batteries are good after buying so you don't run into my issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Guy

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe the power and battery life of this impact! I use it daily and still have not had to recharge it yet! (now that I type it, I will). The 3-way power selector is very nice as well to protect plastic items I'm working on. I used the impact to remove lug nuts to see how it would fare .. it did great! Until wheel number 4 -- but the adapter broke, not this driver! I'm EXTREMELY happy with this .. very comparable to all those who want something less expensive than the Snap-On set.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY NORRIS

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, the power levels (3) are adjustable and with ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool has crazy power. Too much power. Fortunately, the power levels (3) are adjustable and with variable speed trigger on top of that. The batteries are 4 amp hr and very large. Perfect for this tool. I had tried the 2 amp hr battery one before. While good, the 2 amp hr. battery does not really belong on this tool. Splitting hairs, the selector switch for torque is very tough to switch.The directional switch is a bit loose. But is NOT a deal breaker at all. THIS IS THE ONLY DEALBREAKER: Amazon or whoever, raised this price from under $200 to around $250 almost overnight it seems. BOO. HISS. Price WAS $185 Out The Door!
customer_reviews.author: quikz

customer_reviews.title: The do it all drill/driver
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the best tool dewalt has ever made. I've put up garage doors for 17 years and have had one of these guys since they first came out with mini impact. They have been much improved over the years and I can't say enough about this model. You know its great when you only need this one tool to do everything possible to install a garage door. It can handle anything any other drill or driver can handle in any brand. If it had just a hair more torque you could take tires off with it on a truck. It's the ultimate do it all tool. That's unless you need to cut something!

customer_reviews.title: A needed upgrade to a regular drill

Love the LED off delay as well so you don't have to hold down trigger to keep the light on as with my previous drill. 2 × 4Ah batteries is awesome but haven't even needed the 2nd battery yet. So if your current drill seems sluggish you need to get one of these.

customer_reviews.title: one serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I have always been happy with DeWalt for tools (I am a carpenter). While it works well , the handle Has been poorly designed and manufactured. I bumped mine off a two foot ladder and the handle cracked through. I now have a new tool that is being held together with tape. One of the other workers on the site has the same tool; the exact same break. This last week the electrician was on site. THE SAME TOOL; THE EXACT SAME BREAK! This is clearly a problem! This tool has not been designed for the jobsite! Shame on DeWalt for not delivering a durable tool.

Worth every penny, and yes I would buy it again.

customer_reviews.text: Great purchase and a lot of power. Having 2 batteries really helps getting the big projects done quickly. Though I mainly only use 1 battery and still have lots of battery life left before charging. Case is sturdy and keeps the drill, charger and both batteries together.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill that I use every week!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this, but I use this more than him. I use this for an everyday drill to put together furniture, toys and hang pictures. I live that this is lighter weight than a full sized drill, but heavy duty enough to actually drill a hole. The battery is super long lasting. Couldn't live without this now.
customer_reviews.author: Mamareview

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill for small jobs like engine rebuilds and around the farm work!! I really like the 3 different speed/power modes! Each mode has its place in my opinion!! Mode 1 is great for running fasteners without torquing them or worrying about stripping threads out!! It is really gentle and controllable and saves lots of time!! Mode 2 and 3 is great for pesky bolts that you just want out!! Just pull the trigger and its out!! I rarely find myself reaching for my 1/2 impact anymore unless it's really rusted in there!!

customer_reviews.title: this impact driver performs great, but the ergonomics are not the best
customer_reviews.text: this impact driver performs great, but the ergonomics are not the best. the reverse switch is to far forward. it also is loud, overly so. but all in all it is the best impact driver dewalt has put out. it can drive a screw almost as fast as makita's xdt09 which is speaking a lot, although it is not as ergonomic and light or as short ( 7/8" longer). it can drive a big screw through hard wood faster than xdt09. i would say that it is almost half again as fast as dewalt's dcf886

product_meta.title: DEWALT 20V MAX XR Impact Driver Kit, Brushless, 3-Speed, 1/4-Inch, 4.0-Ah (DCF887M2)
product_meta.description: The DEWALT DCF887M2 20V MAX XR Li-ion Brushless 1/4" 3-Speed Impact Driver Kit (4.0 Ah) features a DEWALT built brushless motor and XR Lithium-Ion batteries which deliver more run time and capacity over standard units. This impact driver has 3-speed settings for optimized application versatility, along with Precision Drive in speed 1 for precision applications and added control. It offers three (3) LED lights with 20 second delay after trigger release to provide visibility without shadows. It also allows for one-handed loading 1/4" hex chuck with easy grip sleeve, and accepts 1" bit tips. This unit has a compact and lightweight design to fit into tight areas (2 mm shorter than the previous DCF886). Kit includes: (1) DCF887 - Brushless 1/4" 3-speed Impact driver, (2) 4.0 Ah 20V MAX XR Batteries, (1) Fast charger, Belt Hook.
